definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Di Gong correctly predicted, this did not die Alu is a fake.
sentences.chinese: 狄公料定，这位没死的阿禄是个假的。

sentences.english: I looked at his boots and inferred that he must be a policeman.
sentences.chinese: 我看了看他的靴子，料定他准是警察。

sentences.english: I was certain this old woman was not hurt, and that nobody had seen.
sentences.chinese: 我料定这老女人并没有伤，又没有别人看见。

sentences.english: Don't plan on my going with you, for I expect to be busy this weekend.
sentences.chinese: 别指望我跟你一起去了，这个周末我料定很忙。

sentences.english: Elizabeth was convinced that they held her in contempt.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白料定她们瞧不起她。

sentences.english: She knows that we have no option now.

definition: to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
